meanings.sent1: She keeps mismaking the recipe by adding too much salt.
meanings.sent2: He is always afraid of mismaking important decisions.
meanings.sent3: The robot went haywire, mismaking pancakes instead of waffles.
meanings.sent4: Her artistic vision was mismaking reality into a dreamlike blur.
meanings.sent5: The student's constant mismaking of math problems led to confusion.

meanings.definition: The act of making something incorrectly or poorly.
meanings.sent1: The mismaking of the dress resulted in a crooked hem.
meanings.sent2: His constant mismaking of pottery frustrated his teacher.
meanings.sent3: The mismaking of the cake turned it into a lopsided disaster.
meanings.sent4: The mismaking of the plan caused chaos among the team.
meanings.sent5: The mismaking of the model airplane made it unable to fly properly.
